direction.raw_text: My great-great-grandmother was Princess Margaret Ke'alohilani, one of the last direct descendants of King Kamehameha. She was originally supposed to marry her hanai brother, but she fell in love with her haole banker and estate manager, Edward King, whose parents were missionaries. Between his land deals and her huge inheritance, all of their descendants for generations have watched the past unfurl millions into our laps through leases and sales. Now the Rule Against Perpetuities is forcing us to dissolve the trust, and we're selling the last parcel of undeveloped land. Matt looks up, his glance falling on the portraits of Edward and Margaret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey, that's really unfair. I had - - have -- a lot of respect for her. She's a wonderful woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad her husband found out. You can't win `em all. One more question. Have you ever been inside my bedroom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could have had the decency to lie about that one. Well, she's in Queen's Hospital if you want to say goodbye. That really is all I came to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't you be with her? Matt's face slackens into overwhelming sadness. 111   EXT. HANALEI BAY COTTAGE - NIGHT                               111 Matt swings the screen door open. Alex sits with Julie. Skylar and Colt are still running around the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, great, all remodeled, new appliances. Nice. Alex, we should be getting back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hey, thanks for stopping by. Really nice to meet you both. Maybe we'll see you at the beach tomorrow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 111   CONTINUED:                                                       111 ALEXANDRA Yeah, maybe. After Alex and Julie share a quick kiss goodbye -- a common custom in Hawaii -- Julie turns to Matt. Matt leans in, but instead of going for her cheek, he kisses her FULLY ON THE LIPS. He pulls away, and they exchange a brief, vaguely erotic look. Then he turns away and into the night. 112   INT. AIRPLANE - NIGHT                                            112 The plane is dark except for overhead READING LIGHTS. Again Matt, Sid and the girls sit at the very BACK OF THE PLANE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So when do you think he'll show up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea. Sid leans forward from the middle seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he sorry? I hope he was sorry, man. You could have told his wife, and you didn't. I hope he knows how lucky he is. I would have told her everything. She deserves to know. Or else she's going to be a dumb bitch the rest of her life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to get creepy. Anyway, doesn't matter. That's all behind us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the one we have to worry about telling things to now is Scottie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've asked Dr. Johnston to help us break the news tomorrow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 112   CONTINUED:                                                       112 They turn to look at little Scottie, dead to the world in the window seat. 113   INT. HOSPICE HALLWAY - DAY                                       113 Matt and the kids walk slowly through this different, calmer wing of the hospital looking for the right room-number. Finally they find it and push open the door into -- 114   INT. HOSPICE ROOM - CONTINUOUS                                   114 While still a hospital room, there is no medical equipment present. Bucolic colorful paintings on the wall are intended to be uplifting. But unlike the expansive view outside Elizabeth's ICU window, here the window looks out partially at a CINDER-BLOCK WALL. Sid and the Kings are greeted by DR. JOHNSTON and grief counselor DR. HERMAN, who affects a comforting smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, everyone. Matt. (off their greetings) This is Dr. Herman, whom I told you about. She works with us in counseling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, everyone. Hello. Hi.      Hello. The two professionals allow the Kings to turn their attention to Elizabeth, who now lies with no machines at all. Around her BALLOONS droop, FLOWERS wilt, get-well CARDS lie in a pile. Elizabeth too is wilting and drooping. Her skin is pasty, and her cheeks are hollow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come Mom isn't on any more machines? Is she getting better? The adults exchange glances.     Dr. Herman approaches Scottie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Scottie. (off her nod --) Scottie, I have a present for you. Dr. Herman hands her a little squeaky RUBBER OCTOPUS she pulls from her pocket. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 114   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HERMAN (CONT'D) That's right. It's an octopus. Such a funny creature with its eight legs. But did you know octopi are actually extremely intelligent, like dogs and cats? They have unique personalities, and just like us they have a lot of defense mechanisms. I'm sure you know about the ink sac. She uses ink to confuse her predators. She can camouflage herself. She can emit poison, and some can mimic more dangerous creatures, like the eel. I keep her to remind me of our defense mechanisms -- our ink, our camouflage, our poison, all the things we use to keep away hurt. The reason Dr. Johnston invited me here today is to meet you, Scottie. I've heard a lot about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard that you're a wonderful and unique and spirited girl. Dr. Herman shoots a look at Matt before continuing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I've heard your mom's not doing too well and that she's going to die very soon. All watch Scottie react to this news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, is that true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Scottie. It's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to have to be a very brave girl right now, and you're surrounded by people who love you. I came to meet you and tell you that if you ever want to talk about what you're feeling, I would like to talk to you too. I can help you face what's going on without all the silly defense mechanisms that work for an octopus but not for us. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 114   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOHNSTON Okay.    Thank you, Dr. Herman. Dr. Herman looks at everyone with great sincerity before leaving. Scottie is left holding the octopus. She drops it, and it squeaks a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, well, they say she's very good one- on-one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Mom's going to die for sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. We worked really hard with her, but three other doctors and I agree she's in what we call an irreversible coma. Do you know what that means?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means she doesn't have a brain anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not exactly, but... yes, that's the general idea. So we're doing exactly what she wanted us to do if that ever happened. That's why she's not attached to the machines anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's for the best, Scottie. Look at her. She's not happy like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The purpose of medicine is to heal, and we can't do that now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.     What will we do with her body? Dr. Johnston looks to Matt for this one. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 114   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First Mom's going to give some of her organs to other sick people, so she can help save their lives. That's a really neat thing she's doing. Then we're going to... we're going to scatter her ashes in the ocean. You know how Mom always loved the ocean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her ashes? Scottie looks at her mother, picturing her as ashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When will she die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any day now, I'm afraid.       But you still have some time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. Let me know if you have any more questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Sam. The doctor leaves, and the room is quiet.        Scottie is in a sort of trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here, Scottie. Scottie goes to her sister, who takes her in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do eyeballs burn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Scottie.     Don't think about stuff like that. 115   INT. HOSPICE ROOM - THE NEXT DAY                                   115 Matt and the kids sit in a sort of vigil. Alex and Scottie read books, Matt has brought some paperwork, Sid reads a magazine. Elizabeth emits a SIGH.      All look up a moment before looking back down. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draft 115   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt's PHONE VIBRATES.    Checking the caller ID -- HUGH KING -- he opts not to answer. The door opens, and Elizabeth's brother BARRY THORSON accompanies his parents Scott and Alice into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we are. (to Scottie) Hi, Bingo. Alex. Cheerful Alice doesn't really get what's going on.            An emotional Barry hugs Matt and the girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you are again. Matt and Alex maneuver seats for the Thorsons to sit near the bed. Barry gets his mother situated, then takes a seat himself. Remaining on his feet, old Scott surveys his daughter from a distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what did you decide?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not much left to decide. We're just sort of playing it by ear and making sure she's comfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean what did you decide about the buyer? Who's your buyer? Even Sid and his daughters perk up at this question.           Matt is taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much are you getting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, I'm sure you'll be able to read about it in the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need to read about it.     I can hear about it right now. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 115   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scott, let's not talk about that here. It's not the time for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the same to you, I guess. A million here, a million there. Just ironic, that's all -- Elizabeth coming into this misfortune just as you're coming into a fortune. She gave you everything, Matt. A good, happy home, two beautiful daughters. Matt looks to Barry for help, but Barry's silence and sheepish look imply he buys into his father's propaganda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scott, what's your point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wanted her own boat. She should have had her own boat, one she would have been familiar with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wasn't even driving! Her boat, someone else's boat -- it wouldn't have made any difference. You're not going to blame me for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, sure, quibble about the details. She was a faithful, devoted wife. She deserved more. Why fight it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. She deserved more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Christ's sake, take it easy on the man. Scott turns to Sid like he's about to pop him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father has been doing a really amazing job under the circumstances. His point made, Scott looks at Matt and the girls and shuffles to Elizabeth's bedside, puts his hands on Alice's shoulder. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 115   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we ready to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mom.    Not yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Girls, Sid. Matt, Sid and the girls quietly go into -- 116   INT. HOSPICE HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS                                  116 -- where they take a few steps away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, that guy's a prick.       Was he always like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. Scottie has stayed behind to peek through a crack in the door. Noticing, the others join her. THROUGH THE DOOR -- As Barry and Alice remain seated, their backs to us, Scott stands above his daughter, touching her arm, eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he praying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say goodbye to Elizabeth, Alice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.     Goodbye, Elizabeth. The old man puts his hand over his mouth and squeezes his eyes shut. Then he opens his eyes and places a hand on her forehead, smooths her hair back. WIDE -- Matt and his daughters watch without moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 104. The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 117   INT. KING HOUSE - MATT'S STUDY - NIGHT                             117 Matt sits at his desk lost in thought. The only sound is the tick-tock of an old clock reading 3:20. Then he gets up and starts pacing, shooting occasional glances at the BLUEPRINTS and RENDERINGS atop his desk. DISSOLVE TO: 118   EXT. HIGHWAY OUTSIDE KING FAMILY SHARED PROPERTY - DAY             118 Matt turns off the highway and into a long driveway. 119   INT. KING FAMILY SHARED PROPERTY HOUSE - DAY                       119 Matt opens all front doors and lanai doors, letting air into the old place. He notices old PHOTOS OF KING ANCESTORS. 120   EXT. KING FAMILY SHARED PROPERTY - DAY                             120 Matt walks around the property alone, taking it in and thinking. Like everywhere in Hawai'i, the nature here is powerful -- TREES, BIRDS, SPIDERWEBS. 121   EXT. KING FAMILY SHARED PROPERTY HOUSE - DAY                       121 Matt plops heavily into a chair on the lanai. WIDER -- Matt alone. DISSOLVE TO -- 122   EXT. KING FAMILY SHARED PROPERTY HOUSE - LATER                     122 It's the same angle but now with FORTY KING COUSINS gathered for the poll. We recognize some faces. CLOSER -- Amid drinks held aloft, a CALABASH is passed among the cousins into which the each places a folded BALLOT. Matt sits watching the proceedings with Cousin Hugh, Cousin Six and another ELDERLY COUSIN at a table piled with papers and contracts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth's not doing well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be okay. She's a fighter. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 122   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She's dying.    We took her off the machines. LATER -- Matt, Hugh and Six FINISH THE COUNT while others mill about, mingle, drink -- an early celebration for all except for a group of DISSENTERS off to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no surprise. Other than the holdouts who don't want to sell at all, it's Don Holitzer. Chicago group a distant second. Feels good. We're doing the right thing, Mattie. At least there ain't going to be any Wal-Mart. Now it's your call, and we're all behind you, most of us anyway. (handing him a pen) Go ahead, Captain. Make it official.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's strange, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's strange?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't do anything to own that land. It was entrusted to us. And now we're just... Hugh and Six exchange a concerned look.      For a moment we go VERY CLOSE on Matt's eyes. Then -- MATT (CONT'D) I can't do it. I won't do it.     I'm not going to sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing, Matt? I mean, we know you have a lot on your plate right now, but you're not going to fuck this up for us. It's over. If we don't sell now, it'll be a mess when the trust dissolves. Just sign, go to your wife, done. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 122   CONTINUED: (2)                                                     122 COUSIN   SIX It's inevitable,   Matt. You know that. We'll get out of   debt -- the taxes and maintenance have   been leaching us for far too long. (CONTINUED) 106. The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 122   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want it to go to Holitzer. I don't want it to go to anyone. I want to keep it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Christ's sake. We can't move without your approval. And we don't want to. Hugh tries forcing Matt's hand.   Matt resists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your head's not right, Mattie. Your head's not right. You want a couple days to think it over? Take a couple days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need a couple days. I have the authority, and this is what I want. I haven't wanted something in a long time. We have other businesses we're converting to corporations. We can figure it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's utterly unproductive land. It doesn't generate enough income to pay the goddamn taxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the trustee. You know better than anyone we only have seven years left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I have seven years to figure out how to keep it. Cousin Hugh draws a long breath, looks up at the sky, then back at Matt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll come after you. Just because you're a lawyer doesn't mean the rest of us would be afraid to come after you. But nobody wants to do that. We're family. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 122   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People will be relieved, Hugh, the whole state. I sign that document, it's over. End of the line. Something that was ours to protect will be gone. Even though we're haole as shit and go to private schools and clubs and can't even speak pidgin, let alone Hawaiian, we still carry Hawaiian blood, and we're still tied to this land. And our children are tied to this land. It's a miracle that for whatever bullshit reason 150 years ago, we own this much of... paradise, but we do. And for whatever bullshit reason now, I'm the trustee. And I'm not signing. And if you sue me, it'll only make us closer. Cousin Hugh releases a long breath more like a belch, quickly picks his nose, exchanges a look with Cousin Six. Then he brings his fingers to his mouth to WHISTLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, everybody, listen up. Cousin Mattie has an announcement.     Get ready. Rising to his feet, Matt scans the faces of his relatives. 123   INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY                                          123 From the way Matt, Sid and the girls are positioned around the room, we can tell their presence there is now way of life. Scottie snoozes on the little sofa. We may notice that Elizabeth is even more shrunken. A KNOCK is followed by -- A VASE OF FLOWERS appearing in the doorway, topped by blonde hair and held by thin bronzed arms. It's JULIE SPEER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie.   What are you doing here? He rises to help her find a spot to put the flowers.        She nods to the girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know we just met, but I was thinking about you guys these past few days, and I knew your mom was here. I don't know. I just felt I should stop by. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 123   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember Alex. This is Scottie. Sid. This is Mrs. Speer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you friends with my mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we never met.   But I know a lot about her. As they now do often, Matt and Alex exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we appreciate your coming by. The flowers are lovely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scottie, Alex. Let's go to the cafeteria. The girls follow Sid's prompt, leaving Matt alone with Julie, standing, a dying woman between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: uh, I'm not sure how much you know about my wife's condition, but she's going to die very soon. Any minute, really. That's sort of why we're all here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. That's why I came. Because I know. I came because my husband wouldn't. And that just didn't seem right. I thought someone from my family should come. Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I came to your house like that. Just barged in on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. I assume you're angry. Of course you are. I'm angry too. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 123   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he told you, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After you left that night, he was acting really weird. Then I started smelling it all over him. I'd already smelled it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I finally got it out of him. We've been going crazy ever since. Not easy with the kids around. It's all something I never could have imagined. And then your family's decision about the land. I think you're doing the right thing, but Brian is -- well, it's all so complicated and confusing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brian told me everything. Well, how can I ever know it's everything? When did you find out? Have you known for a while?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a few days ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm angry, but I'm just so sorry.    I can't imagine what you're going through. Do you mind if I say something to her? Matt is unsure but what else can he do?   Julie approaches the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth, I'm Julie. Brian's wife. I just want to say I forgive you. I forgive you for trying to take Brian. I forgive you for almost destroying my family. I have to forgive you. Even though I want to hate you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 123   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. All right. That's enough, Julie. I think... I think that's enough. Matt walks to the door and opens it. Alex and Sid -- who've clearly had their ears against the door -- scamper away, unnoticed by Matt and Julie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't love her. Just so you know. He didn't really love her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why I'm here. Julie heads to the door. At the door, she looks at Matt. Matt looks at her. She leaves. Matt is left alone with his wife, and he realizes suddenly that this is his moment. He walks to the bed, takes her hand, rubs his palm over her hair. He says something to her as though silently praying, then realizes he should say it aloud. He presses his lips to hers and puts his hand on her stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Elizabeth. Goodbye, my love, my friend, my pain, my joy. Goodbye. Goodbye. Goodbye. 124   INT. HOSPICE HALLWAY - DAY                                     124 The door to Elizabeth's room opens, and Alexandra emerges, a far-away sadness on her face. She walks slowly toward -- A NEARBY WAITING AREA -- where Matt sits with Scottie and Sid. Matt and Sid rise to comfort her, but she's not in the mood. She allows them each to hug her briefly before turning to Scottie. Signaling to Matt to let her do this, Alex escorts a fearful Scottie toward Elizabeth's room, and, reassuring her, guides her little sister inside. Matt and Sid are left alone. 125   EXT. MONTAGE - DAY                                             125 To be determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft 112. 126   EXT. THE OCEAN - DAY                                                126 PADDLES in the water. A BOX ENCIRCLED BY LEIS sits tied to the seat of a small outrigger CANOE. MATT AND THE GIRLS navigate the canoe through the surf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far do we have to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that far. Just past the break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steer straighter, Dad.     And a little faster, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying. 127   LATER --                                                            127 (CONTINUED) 113. The Descendants
